Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • User
  • public class User
extends java.lang.Object
    The core class for any user of the system. It handles all basic functionalities shared by all user types. Some functions are prepared for extra functionality of specific uber classes, but the class does ensure rights are checked.

    • Method Detail

      • getInvalidID

        public java.lang.String getInvalidID()

      • login

        public boolean login​(java.lang.String username,
                     char[] password)
        Login a user. The login function will continously call authenticate user, until the maximum login attempts have been reached. If this occurs, it is assumed that the user might have forgotten their password. If the user is of type admin, they can directly change their password. Otherwise they need to request an admin to change their password since they are the only ones allowed to change passwords without knowledge of the previous password. If successful, and active session is defined.
        Parameters:
        username - String the username of the user attempting to login
        password - char[] the password of the user attempting to login (char[] for security purposes)
        Returns:
        boolean representing if the login was successful

      • createActiveSession

        private void createActiveSession()
        Creates an active session by reading in the user data

      • isSessionActive

        private boolean isSessionActive()
        A simple function that is used internally to check if a session is active. Activeness is tested by ensuring the session ID is not the specified `invaldID` as well as the fact that the current time has not passed the expiration time.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if the session is active - or not

      • invalidateSession

        private void invalidateSession()
        Invalidates a session by changing the ID to the invalidID as well as setting the expiration time to 1 hour prior

      • forceInvalidSessionBurnout

        private void forceInvalidSessionBurnout()
        Not only invalidates a session, but also closes the system if the user does not relogin

      • authenticateUser

        private boolean authenticateUser​(java.lang.String uname,
                                 char[] pword)
        Authenticates a user based on the username and password provided. Username is stored usind MD5 hashing and the password is stored usind SHA256 hashing. All passwords are handled as char[] since garbage collection for Strings is not immediate, and thus this could be a security issue. If the user is authenticated, the user name is stored. Password is cleared.
        Parameters:
        uname - String: the username of the user requesting authentication
        pword - char[]: the password, passed as a char array for security reasons (see above)
        Returns:
        boolean: indicating if authentication was successful

      • changePassword

        public boolean changePassword​(java.lang.String username,
                              char[] oldPassword,
                              char[] newPassword)
        Allows a user to change their password. If the user is an admin, then no old password is required.
        Parameters:
        username - String the username for which a password change should occur
        oldPassword - char[] the old password
        newPassword - char[] the new password to overwrite the old one with
        Returns:
        boolean that indicates if the change was successful

      • noUsers

        public static boolean noUsers()
        A static method that checks if any users exist in the system. Can be used to evaluate if a default admin must be created.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if no users are present

      • getUserId

        public java.lang.String getUserId()
        Returns the user id
        Returns:
        String the user ID

      • readDictFromFile

        private java.lang.String[][] readDictFromFile​(java.lang.String fname)
        Reads a form of dictionary used by the system. The format is used for the user authentication. Each line of the authentication file is in the form: 
             [MD5 hash of username] : [SHA256 hash of password] : [Type of user]
        Parameters:
        fname - String the filename from which to read the specific dictionary
        Returns:
        String[][] representing the occurances split into their respective sections denoted by the format

      • writeDictToFile

        private boolean writeDictToFile​(java.lang.String[][] dict,
                                java.lang.String fname,
                                boolean overwrite)
        Writes a system dict to the specified file. Usually used to update the authentication file. For the format check the reading function defined in `see`
        Parameters:
        dict - String[][] which is the system dict to write
        fname - String representing the file to write to
        overwrite - boolean that indicates if the file should be overwritten or appended to
        Returns:
        boolean representing if the write was successful
        See Also:
        writeDictToFile(String[][], String, boolean)

      • readUserInfo

        private java.lang.String[] readUserInfo​(User someone)
        Reads the data connected to a certain user
        Parameters:
        someone - User the user to get the information for
        Returns:
        String[] representing the users information

      • updateUserInfo

        private boolean updateUserInfo​(User you)
        Updates a users record after anythin has changed
        Parameters:
        you - User the user whose data should be changed
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if the update was successful
